title: How Ecuador reached the shocking point of a political assassination
description: Ecuador is in a state of emergency after the assassination of a leading presidential candidate. Here's how the country got to this point.

title: In 'Red, White & Royal Blue,' a director centers true queer intimacy on screen
description: When Matthew López thought about adapting the acclaimed book into a movie, he he had a very clear idea about what a central sex scene should look like.

title: Former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried ordered to jail after judge revokes his bail
description: A federal judge has decided the disgraced former CEO of the cryptocurency exchange should be sent to jail as he awaits trial on fraud charges.

title: The national kid mullet contest is back — and the hairdos are longer and wilder
description: The annual USA Mullet Championship recently announced the Top 25 for the kids category. Voting for the final round ends Friday right.

title: A slightly sadistic experiment aims to find out why heat drives up global conflict
description: The subjects were assigned to one of two rooms: 68 degrees or a sweat-inducing 86 degrees. Then they were told to play a computer game that can bring out the worst in human nature.

title: Coronavirus FAQ: Is it wiser to get a booster now or wait for the new fall booster?
description: Maybe it's not a summer surge but COVID numbers are definitely ticking up. For those with concerns due to personal risk factors or the start of the school year, the booster question is top of mind.

title: Garland names special counsel in Hunter Biden investigation
description: David Weiss, a Trump appointee as U.S. attorney who was retained during the Biden administration, has been investigating Hunter Biden since 2019.

title: Judge delivers mixed ruling on protective order in Trump's Jan. 6 case
description: A protective order would bar Trump and his attorneys from improperly using any evidence that prosecutors share with the defense team.

title: UPS union negotiated a historic contract. Now workers have the final say
description: The Teamsters union reached a tentative deal with UPS, narrowly averting a nationwide strike. Rank-and-file union members are voting on whether to approve the contract.

title: Coal miners say new limits on rock dust 'could save some lives'
description: Miners and their advocates testify in favor of new silica regulations aimed at preventing black lung disease

title: Don't call it 'vegan' and other tips from hospitals to get people to eat less meat
description: Turns out diners are more likely to get on board for altruistic reasons rather than health. That's what one hospital learned after it pledged to reduce food-related greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Up First briefing: Hawaii fire damage repair could take years; how to see the Perseids
description: Mass evacuations and recovery efforts continue in Maui after deadly wildfires. The Perseid meteor shower peaks this weekend.

title: The Titans' Terrell Williams temporarily will be the NFL's 4th Black head coach
description: Williams, who joined the Tennessee Titans in 2018 as a longtime defensive line coach, will step in for head coach Mike Vrabel during Saturday's pre-season game against Chicago.

title: The plot thickens: The battle over books comes at a cost
description: No longer are just books under fire, but also the library administrators, teachers and long-beloved librarians who are defending them.

title: A dancer's killing — over voguing — highlights the dangers Black LGBTQ Americans face
description: O'Shae Sibley was stabbed for voguing to Beyoncé at a New York City gas station. His death, which is being prosecuted as a hate crime, comes as anti-LGBTQ bills and incidents surge across the U.S.

title: Beer in Britain's pubs just got cheaper, thanks to changes in the alcohol tax
description: The U.K. has lowered taxes on draft beers in pubs, in what it's calling its biggest shakeup to alcohol tax in a century. But taxes on other alcoholic beverages are rising, so not everyone is cheering.

title: Recovery on Maui could take years, officials say, as the death toll rises again
description: Officials say it could take years — or longer — to repair the damage from this week's wildfires that devastated parts of Maui, claimed dozens of lives and razed a historic town.

title: Ford is losing a lot of money in electric cars — but CEO Jim Farley is charging ahead
description: In a wide-ranging interview, Ford's CEO shares his thoughts about his company's ramp-up in electric cars and the state of charging. (He's very happy about that Tesla deal, too.)

title: Scorched by Maui wildfire, historic Lahaina banyan tree appears still standing
description: The magnificent tree is the size of a city block, the product of doting efforts by the Lahaina's residents. Aerial footage shows the tree charred but still standing amid a downtown devastated by fire.

title: Weekly news quiz: From Beyoncé to Clarence Thomas and more rogue animals
description: It's all money, money, money in this week's news quiz, from Beyoncé's tour dropping $100,000 on something to Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas reportedly accepting more gifts from billionaires.

title: Why the sell-off in bond markets could impact you
description: The bond markets are being hit hard by the Fed's aggressive rate hikes and recent events including a downgrade of the country's ratings. These are three ways in which that could impact the U.S.

title: Parliament of the World's Religions seeks understanding and action
description: The Parliament of the World's Religions is about to begin in Chicago. The first Parliament took place in 1893 and is considered the beginning of the modern interfaith movement.

title: The Perseid meteor shower peaks this weekend. Here's how to watch
description: The Perseid meteor shower sends bright streaks shooting across the night sky. Stargazers can watch the shower peak this weekend, but the key, experts say, will be patience.

title: Ecuador arrests 6 Colombians in slaying of presidential candidate
description: Ecuador's evolution into a major drug trafficking hub and the ensuing surge of violence weighs on the nation following the killing of a presidential candidate whose life's work was to fight crime.
